sens.mc: to have a practical understanding of
sens.vi: a career diplomat who knows several languages
sens.rel: appreciate, apprehend, cognize, fathom, follow, ken [chiefly Scottish], perceive, savvy; have, possess; catch on (to), pick up
sens.near: misapprehend, misconceive, misinterpret, misknow, misperceive, misunderstand

sens.mc: to come to a knowledge of (something) by living through it
sens.vi: a gripping news story about orphans who have come to know full well the horrors of war
sens.syn: endure, feel, have, know, pass, see, suffer, sustain, taste, undergo, witness
sens.rel: encounter, meet; accept, receive; assimilate, digest

sens.mc: to have a clear idea of
sens.vi: I think I know what you're trying to say
sens.syn: appreciate, apprehend, assimilate, behold, catch, catch on (to), cognize, compass, conceive, cotton (to or on to), decipher, decode, dig, discern, get, grasp, grok, intuit, know, make, make out, perceive, recognize, register, savvy, see, seize, sense, tumble (to), twig, understand
sens.rel: absorb, digest, take in; realize; fathom, penetrate, pierce
sens.near: misapprehend, misconceive, misconstrue, misinterpret, misperceive, misread, mistake, misunderstand
